subclassFeature.name: The Maleficar
entries: The study of magic is a field that many devoted scholars and wizards strive to master and understand. Many schools of magic are broadly accepted and admired all across the Forgotten Realms, while others are rejected and taboo. Mages who study the forbidden art of extracting magical power from blood are known as Maleficars. Practitioners of these arts usually do so in secret, as their magical abilities, rituals and spells tend to terrify anyone who witnesses, excluding most wizards and other magic users.

The purposes of studying blood magic depends on each wizard. Many Maleficars study the magical source of blood for the pursuit of incredible power, willing to sacrifice anything if needed be. Some might practice these arts because, as magic researchers, it is their right to do so if not given an unethical use. Others might feel the duty of mastering these abilities so they can use them for others benefit, even if that leads to being exposed.

Maleficars are pursued due to them being perceived as cruel and malevolent. Nonetheless, those assumptions are not unjustified, as many of these wizards are manipulated by fiends attracted to this type of magic power. Those who bend their will to these evil beings travel through the realms looking for life to usurp in benefit of their masters. The constant pressure caused by confronting these fiends is an evil that any practitioner of this art must face, even those with the best intentions are vulnerable to giving in to temptation or surrender to madness.

entries.name: Maleficar Research
entries: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy a necromancy spell into your spellbook is halved. Although the purpose of blood magic does not necessarily have necrotic means, experimenting with the magical power of blood made you proficient in the understanding of the necromancy school of magic.

entries.name: The Magical Secret of Blood
entries: When casting a spell of 5th level or lower, you may forgo spending a spell slot by sequentially rolling any number of your wizard hit dies until the rolled values add twice the level of the spell. No modifiers are added to these rolls. The spell must be one that you know and are able to cast.

In case of running out of hit dies or not being willing to spend more, you may spend health points equal to 5 times the difference between your roll's result and your goal. The number of health points spent count as damage to maintain concentration effects. You are still able to use this feature if no hit dies are available, taking your roll's result as 0.

If the goal is not reached on any way, the result of all hit dies is lost, the spell is not cast, and you lose your action, bonus action or reaction used to cast the spell. In case of spending more health points than your current health, the spell casts, but you die immediately right after.
You may use this feature up to a number of times equal to half your intelligence modifier rounded up (minimum of 1), regaining all expended uses when finishing a short or long rest.

Starting at 14th level, you may cast a spell of 6th and 7th level using this feature. Doing so requires adding four times the spell level when rolling hit dies instead of just two. You cannot attempt to cast a 6th or 7th level spell using this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Life Drainer
entries: You get proficient at managing your own blood, as well as reaping others'. At 6th level, you add the {@spell vampiric touch} spell to your spellbook. If you already know this spell, you can instead choose a necromancy spell of any spell list for which you have spell slots. This spell counts as a wizard spell for you. The attack range of your {@spell vampiric touch} spell increases to 30ft and counts as a ranged spell attack when your target is outside melee range.

subclassFeature.name: Maleficar Resilience
entries: At 10th level, you get resilient to physical wounding and discomfort as a consequence of your studies in blood magic. You may roll any constitution saving throw with advantage.

Additionally, the rate at which your body regenerates has improved. When you spend hit dies to heal yourself at the end of a short rest, you may add your intelligence modifier to every hit die rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Regeneration Mastery
entries: You unveiled a secret to exceed your body's regeneration limits. Starting at 14th level, after completing a short rest but before spending any hit dies to heal yourself, you can recover a number of hit dies equal to you intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). When you do so, you cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, if you roll initiative and have no uses of The Magical Secret of Blood remaining, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: The Magical Secret of Blood Improvement
entries: You can now cast 6th and 7th level spells as specified in The Magical Secret of Blood feature.
